definition: May 7 Cadre School (forcing educated people into re-education and peasant labor during Cultural Revolution)/abbr. for 五七幹部學校|五七干部学校[wu3 qi1 gan4 bu4 xue2 xiao4]
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
school for cadres/May 7 Cadre School 五七幹校|五七干校
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
to work in the fields (esp. young school-leavers)/forced agricultural experience for city intellectuals
the Four Cleanups Movement (1963-66), which aimed to cleanse the politics, economy, organization and ideology of the Communist Party
Anti-Rightist Movement, Mao's purge of "rightists" after the Hundred Flowers Campaign ended in 1957
educated youth (sent to work in farms during the Cultural Revolution)
abbr. for 勞動改造|劳动改造[lao2 dong4 gai3 zao4]/reform through labor/laogai (prison camp)
anti-rightist/abbr. for 反右派鬥爭|反右派斗争[Fan3 you4 pai4 Dou4 zheng1]
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
after liberation (i.e. after the Communist's victory)/after the establishment of PRC in 1949
struggle, criticize, and transform (Cultural Revolution catchcry)
